Key Match Events: Lassina Traoré scored a brace in the first half (35e, 38e)
Hassane Bandé scored the third goal for Burkina Faso in the 60th minute (s.p)
Zeliat Nkhoma reduced the deficit for Malawi in the 80th minute (80e)
Post-Match Reflections: Burkina Faso takes the lead in Group L with 4 points, better than Senegal (2nd place)
Burundi (3rd place, 3 points) and Malawi (4th place, 0 points) follow
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at the Stade du 26-Mars in Bamako
Burkina Faso had some changes in their lineup, with Lassina Traoré starting
